Sentencas: The triode fuel cell design and operation concept was applied as an alternative means for controlling and enhancing the carbon tolerance of state-of-the-art solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) anodes.
Titulo: Enhanced Carbon Deposition Tolerance of SOFC Anodes Under Triode Operation

Sentencas: The triode cell configuration entails the introduction of a third electrode in addition to the anode and cathode, driven by an auxiliary circuit which is run in electrolytic mode.
Titulo: Enhanced Carbon Deposition Tolerance of SOFC Anodes Under Triode Operation

Sentencas: In this way the cell is forced to operate at controlled potential differences that are inaccessible under standard operation, and thus introduces a controllable variable into fuel cell operation.
Titulo: Enhanced Carbon Deposition Tolerance of SOFC Anodes Under Triode Operation

Sentencas: In the present study, the effectiveness of the triode approach was evaluated for the in situ control of the rate of carbon deposition in commercial multilayer NiO-GDC and NiOYSZ SOFC anodes.
Titulo: Enhanced Carbon Deposition Tolerance of SOFC Anodes Under Triode Operation

Sentencas: The study involved typical and triode operation of SOFC button cells under CH4 steam reforming conditions, and it was found that the application of a small electrolytic current under triode operation resulted in significantly less carbon built-up on the anode compared to the standard SOFC operation.
Titulo: Enhanced Carbon Deposition Tolerance of SOFC Anodes Under Triode Operation
